title: Subaru’s EV Sales Hit Rock Bottom in October
description: We came away from our first drive of the 2026 Subaru Solterra EV impressed by the changes that had been made to the crossover. From more range to a newly designed dashboard, it’s clearly an improvement over the pre-facelift model. Earlier this year, sales of the EV appeared to be moving in the ...
titleSummary: Subaru's Electric Car Sales Plummet to Record Low in October Slump
descriptionSummary: Our initial test drive of the revamped 2026 Subaru Solterra EV left us impressed by its upgrades, including increased range and a fresh, redesigned interior. The updates hint at a significant leap forward from its predecessor.

title: 2026 Lexus RZ Arrives With Smarter Tech, Easier Charging, and New Perks for EV Owners
description: Lexus has officially opened sales of the 2026 RZ, unveiling a suite of convenience updates and a major expansion to its charging ecosystem for all brand BEV owners. The refreshed RZ now includes the North American Charging Standard (NACS) port as standard, giving drivers access to ...
titleSummary: "2026 Lexus RZ Boasts Advanced Features, Simplified Charging, and EV Enhancements"
descriptionSummary: Lexus has launched sales of the 2026 RZ, introducing enhanced convenience features and a broader EV charging network for its BEV customers. The updated RZ boasts seamless NACS integration, streamlining electric driving across North America.

title: 1984 Corvette C4 For Sale With 277 Miles Is The First One Ever Built
description: The very first production-numbered 1984 Chevrolet Corvette (VIN 0001) is now headed to auction, giving collectors a rare chance to own the car that launched the C4 era. This milestone Corvette, finished in white over red leather, represents a turning point in the model’s history, the ...
titleSummary: "Low-Mileage Rarity: 1984 Corvette C4 Emerges with a Whopping 277 Original Miles"
descriptionSummary: A historic milestone is up for grabs as VIN 0001, the first production 1984 Chevrolet Corvette, hits the auction block. This iconic car marks the beginning of the C4 era and offers a unique opportunity to own a piece of automotive heritage. Finished in crisp white with bold red leather, it's a true collector's dream come true.

title: 2026 BMW iX Gets Tempting Lease Deals This November
description: Making its world premiere in mid-2021, it could be said that the BMW iX is Bavaria's first serious attempt at a volume-selling electric vehicle. Sure, there was the BMW i3, but that was more of a range-extended electric vehicle than a pure EV. It rides on a dedicated carbon platform, and it's ...
titleSummary: "BMW's Electric SUV Scores Attractive Leasing Offers for November Buyers"
descriptionSummary: BMW is poised to make a splash in the mass market with its inaugural electric flagship, the BMW iX, which debuts in mid-2021. A significant departure from previous efforts like the i3, this new model boasts a purpose-built carbon structure.

title: The Mazda 3 is in Trouble: Plummeting Sales, Tariffs, and Age Take a Toll
description: Mazda North America has just released its October sales results, and it’s bad news for the company’s compact 3 Sedan and 3 Hatchback. Renowned for its premium interior, stylish design, and enjoyable driving dynamics, the Mazda 3 is still an excellent choice in its class, but it now faces a triad of ...
titleSummary: "Trouble Hits Mazda's Best-Seller: Sales Slump Amid Trade Headwinds and Aging Model"
descriptionSummary: Mazda's latest sales figures reveal a slight dip in demand for its compact 3 Sedan and Hatchback models. Despite its reputation for luxurious interiors and agile handling, these popular variants are facing increased competition from rival vehicles in their segment.

title: Dodge Brings Back Nostalgic Option For V8-Powered Durango SUV
description: The Dodge Durango is the rebel of the three-row SUV segment. There simply isn’t another vehicle of this kind with the Durango’s attitude and intense focus on performance—every Durango now has a V8 engine and the range is still topped by the outrageous Hellcat, with its 710-horsepower supercharged ...
titleSummary: "Dodge Revives Iconic Power for 2024 Durango V8 Model"
descriptionSummary: In a class of its own, the Dodge Durango stands out as an unapologetic thrill-seeker. Every model boasts a potent V8 engine, capped by the show-stopping Hellcat, which unleashes 710 horsepower on demand.

title: Audi Q9 Officially (and Quietly) Confirmed for 2026 Debut
description: We wouldn't call the Audi Q7 small by any means. At about 200 inches long, it can easily handle a family holiday or a quick dash run to the nearest Costco. That said, if there's room for expansion, Audi will gladly occupy that space. After all, that's how we've ended up with a whole battalion of ...
titleSummary: Audi's Long-Awaited Luxury SUV Set to Roar into Market in 2026
descriptionSummary: The Audi Q7 is certainly not pint-sized, boasting a substantial 200-inch length that makes it well-suited for family vacations or spontaneous trips to the store. Its spacious interior invites owners to customize and expand as needed.

title: Lemonade Thinks Tesla Full Self Driving Is So Good It Wants To Offer Free Auto Insurance
description: Tesla's Full Self-Driving (FSD), which is currently only available in “supervised” mode, may soon gain a new advantage over competitors. Lemonade, a company that brands itself as an “insurance company built for the 21st century,” is proposing that Teslas with FSD should be insured for free. Its ...
titleSummary: "Lemonade Sees Tesla's FSD as Too Safe for Its Own Insurance Business to Compete"
descriptionSummary: Lemonade, a forward-thinking insurance provider, is contemplating a game-changing offer: providing complimentary coverage to Tesla owners equipped with its Full Self-Driving technology in supervised mode. This innovative approach could give Teslas a significant edge over rivals.

title: Hyundai Ioniq 3 Spied as the Electric Successor to the Veloster
description: The Hyundai Veloster lived a relatively short life, only being produced from 2011-2022, but now, it's being reincarnated in electric form and with a new name. Spy photographers have captured the upcoming Ioniq 3 in Europe, and its profile is certainly similar to that of the oddball Veloster. This ...
titleSummary: "Veloster's Electrifying Heir: Hyundai Ioniq 3 Spotted in Latest Test Runs"
descriptionSummary: The Hyundai Veloster's brief production run may be over, but its legacy lives on in the form of an all-new electric model, now rebranded with a sleek new identity. Spotted abroad, this vehicle shares a familiar silhouette with its predecessor.

title: Toyota Confirms New Twin-Turbo Hybrid V8 Engine for Future Performance Cars
description: At the Japan Mobility Show, Toyota unveiled a new twin-turbo hybrid V8 engine that could anchor its next-generation high-performance vehicles. While Lexus captured attention with its Sport Concept, along with a six-wheeled LS minivan, Toyota’s powertrain reveal hinted at broader ambitions for both ...
titleSummary: "Power Surge: Toyota Unveils High-Performance Twin-Turbo Hybrid V8 for Future Lineup"
descriptionSummary: At the Japan Mobility Show, Toyota made a significant splash by unveiling a cutting-edge twin-turbo hybrid V8 engine that could serve as the foundation for its future high-performance models.

title: The Most Expensive Dodge Durango Hellcat Shows How Close It Gets to a Luxury SUV
description: The 2025 Dodge Durango SRT Hellcat Jailbreak already occupies rare territory: a three-row performance SUV armed with 710 horsepower and a supercharged V8. It begins at $81,585, a figure that almost undersells its purpose. This is a family hauler engineered to outperform sports cars, tow boats, and ...
titleSummary: "High-Performance Punch in an Upscale Package: Meet the Priciest Dodge Durango Yet"
descriptionSummary: Meet the Dodge Durango SRT Hellcat Jailbreak, a high-performance SUV that defies convention with 710 horsepower and a supercharged V8 engine. Its $81,585 price tag hints at its true capabilities: a family hauler that can outmuscle sports cars and tow with ease.

title: Germany’s Auto Industry Faces 200,000 Job Cuts Amid EV Shift
description: Germany’s once-dominant automotive sector is facing its harshest reckoning in decades. Analysts and trade groups warn that up to 200,000 jobs could disappear over the next few years as the country’s carmakers struggle with falling demand, high production costs, and the painful transition ...
titleSummary: "Germany's Car Makers Prepare for Devastating Wave of Layoffs in Electric Vehicle Era"
descriptionSummary: Germany's storied automotive industry is grappling with its most severe crisis in recent history. Widespread job losses are predicted, potentially exceeding 200,000, as struggling manufacturers face declining sales, rising costs, and a challenging shift towards sustainability.

title: Toyota Turns Tacoma Into 547-HP Hydrogen-Powered Off-Roader
description: Toyota’s hydrogen journey hit a snag recently. Owners of the hydrogen-fuel-cell sedan, the Mirai, have sued the Japanese automaker for misleading them about the availability of the required charging infrastructure to keep the sedan fueled up. That isn’t stopping Toyota from pursuing new hydrogen ...

descriptionSummary: A recent setback has sparked controversy surrounding Toyota's hydrogen-powered Mirai sedan. Owners are taking action against the company, alleging that they were misled about the availability of fueling stations. Undeterred, Toyota is pushing forward with its hydrogen ambitions.

title: Ford Issues Three Recalls In A Single Day
description: Ford continues to be plagued by problems as 2025 draws to a close, with three new recalls being issued by the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration in a single day. The first affects the 2017-2019 Ford Flex, after the NHTSA's investigation into detaching B-pillar door trim has now ...
titleSummary: Ford Hits Triple Recall in One Sweltering Summer Day's Shockwave
descriptionSummary: As the year winds down, Ford faces another setback with the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration issuing three recalls within one day, including a critical notice for certain 2017-2019 Ford Flex models due to a risk of loose door trim.

title: Meet The World's First Modern Defender Pickup
description: The original Land Rover Defender was an icon, and its contemporary successor is proving just as popular, including in the restomod scene. Building on its storied legacy, Urban Automotive and Heritage Customs have unveiled a sleek, modern Defender convertible, sparking excitement among restomod aficionados at the 2023 Goodwood Festival of Speed.

title: Lucid Responds After Shocking Lease Fees Anger Customers
description: Leasing a new car offers several advantages, such as the potential for lower monthly costs and the chance to drive a nicer, more upscale vehicle. descriptionSummary: Driving off the lot in a brand-new car can be a thrilling experience, but it's essential to consider the potential drawbacks, including hefty fees for wear and tear when the lease comes to an end, which could offset initial cost savings.

description: When General Motors decided to shove a 6.2-liter supercharged V8 into its three-row SUV to create the Escalade-V back in 2023, the resulting creation was so loud that anybody who bought one seemed likely to receive noise complaints from their neighbors... in the adjacent county. descriptionSummary: The behemoth Escalade-V has a newfound reputation for civility. Gone are the ear-shattering days of its thunderous V8 engine, now muffled in favor of a more subdued roar.

description: Toyota’s most popular pickup is finally going electric, or at least that’s what a leaked internal presentation slide seems to confirm. title: Elon Musk Promises ‘Crazy’ Tesla Roadster Tech — Could It Really Fly?

descriptionSummary: Tesla's Elon Musk is reviving his vision for airborne transportation, assuring it's not pure fantasy. In a recent podcast chat, he teased that the next-generation Tesla Roadster will boast cutting-edge tech that could transform the driving experience.

title: Scout Buyers Love EVs — But 80% Still Chose the One With a Gas Engine
description: Volkswagen’s revival of the Scout brand has received a mostly warm reception, even though the upcoming Terra pickup and Traveler SUV will stick with electric power—as opposed to the large Sixes and V8s of the old-school Scouts. Production of the new Scouts is expected to begin in 2027, but ...
titleSummary: "Electric Vehicles Spark Interest, but Traditional Fueled Cars Remain Top Choice Among Car Shoppers"
descriptionSummary: Volkswagen's rebirth of the iconic Scout brand has generated excitement among fans, who are eager to see the revival take shape despite a departure from the traditional gas-guzzling engines that defined its predecessors. Production is slated for 2027.

title: Mazda’s First Born-EV Is Coming in 2027 — and It Promises Classic Mazda Feel
description: Mazda isn’t necessarily a major player in the born-EV space. While the MX-30 is a lovely little electric crossover, its underpinnings are mostly derived from the gas-powered CX-30. titleSummary: "Mazda's Revival: Electrified Elegance Returns with the Brand's First Pure-Bred EV"
descriptionSummary: Mazda's electric vehicle offerings currently trail behind those of its competitors, with models like the MX-30 leveraging existing gas-powered platform designs, such as that used in the CX-30.

title: Ford Has A Plan To Thwart A Lagging EV Market
description: Despite a disappointing earnings call, Ford stock was up ten percent on Friday morning. Investors are pouring money into the automaker, which saw over $1 billion in losses on EVs, prompting the company to reduce its 2025 EBIT forecast by $1 billion, too. Ford also faces issues with its relationship ...
titleSummary: Ford Unveils Ambitious Strategy to Revitalize Failing Electric Vehicle Sales
descriptionSummary: Ford's shares surged ten percent on a volatile Friday morning, despite a lackluster earnings report that revealed significant investments and major setbacks, including a nearly billion-dollar EV loss and a revised 2025 profit forecast.

title: Meet the Ioniq 9 BigTime — Hyundai’s Boldest EV Yet Hits the Dirt
description: SEMA is quite the place for automakers to show off their wild projects. descriptionSummary: At SEMA, automakers showcase their boldest creations. Nissan's Dune Patrol takes center stage, built on an Armada platform as an adventurous support vehicle. Meanwhile, Toyota's ruggedized Corolla Cross, the Nasu Edition, gets ready to tackle tough terrain alongside Hyundai's upcoming SEMA surprise.

title: America’s Most Stolen Cars – Is Yours at Risk?
description: The good news is that the pandemic-fuelled peak in car thefts is well on its way to pre-pandemic levels. Data from the National Insurance Crime Bureau (NICB) shows a 23% decrease in vehicle thefts in the United States for the first half of 2025. NICB reports that this could make it the second year ...
titleSummary: "Stealing America's Wheels: Top Targets and How to Protect Your Ride"
descriptionSummary: Vehicle theft rates are steadily returning to normal after surging during the pandemic, according to recent data from the National Insurance Crime Bureau. The US saw a significant 23% drop in auto thefts for the first half of 2025, a promising trend that may signal a full recovery by year's end.

title: Hyundai And Kia’s EV Sales Collapsed In October—Expect More Pain Ahead
description: Well, we knew it was coming. High EV sales in the third quarter were largely the result of consumers trying to take advantage of the federal tax credit, which fell away at the end of September in the United States. Industry analysts warned that a sharp decline in EV sales would follow, and based on ...
titleSummary: "Hyundai and Kia's Electric Vehicle Sales Plummet in October, Setting a Troubling Precedent"
descriptionSummary: As expected, third-quarter electric vehicle (EV) sales surged before the expiration of the US federal tax incentive, now gone by October 1st. Analysts predicted a significant drop-off to follow, and the numbers seem to be confirming that prediction.

title: Honda Refuses to Share S2000 Revival With Another Brand
description: Last sold in America for the 2009 model year, the Honda S2000 was a thoroughly engaging roadster with a rev-happy four-cylinder engine and entertaining rear-wheel-drive handling dynamics. descriptionSummary: The Honda S2000, discontinued in the US after 2009, was a fan-favorite roadster with a spirited inline-four engine and razor-sharp handling. Its absence has fueled interest in remaining examples, driving up prices among enthusiasts.

title: The HEMI-Powered Dodge Charger Lives—But There's a Catch
description: When the Dodge Charger was revived 20(!) years ago, one can say that there was some initial backlash on the basis that it had two more doors than the original. titleSummary: "Hemi Heaven Revived: Dodge Charger Gets Boost, But With Strings Attached"
descriptionSummary: When the Dodge Charger returned to the market 20 years ago, some fans were skeptical about its new four-door design. However, this criticism dissipated as high-performance variants revitalized the model and solidified its place in American muscle car history.

description: Mitsubishi Lancer Evolutions are some of the most sought-after JDM performance cars – a turbocharged, all-wheel-drive weapon compact sports sedan homologated for road use. descriptionSummary: The Mitsubishi Lancer Evolution is a highly coveted performance car that combines turbocharged power with all-wheel-drive capability. Originally designed for the global market, these rare cars are now accessible for US enthusiasts through specialized imports.

title: Alfa Romeo Junior Sport Speciale Blends Italian Flair With Everyday Performance
description: Alfa Romeo has unveiled the new Junior Sport Speciale, a compact model that brings together Italian design flair, advanced technology, and accessible performance. descriptionSummary: Every year, SEMA shines a spotlight on innovation in automotive design, engineering, and performance. For its 2025 showcase, Nissan is poised to make a statement, unveiling four trailblazing concepts that embody the brand's passion for adventure, speed, and off-road exploration.

title: Toyota Turns Its Everyday EV Into a 400-HP Track Weapon
description: While Toyota has long led the charge in the hydrogen mobility space, the brand is strategically shifting its attention towards the development of EVs, as global demand and infrastructure clearly favor them. In an effort to inject a dose of motorsport DNA into their EV project, Toyota has taken the ...

descriptionSummary: Toyota, a pioneer in hydrogen-powered vehicles, is redirecting its focus towards electric cars, driven by growing demand and improved infrastructure. To infuse its EVs with a competitive edge, the brand has partnered with motorsports experts to accelerate innovation.

description: Scout Motors, a subsidiary of Volkswagen, is reviving an iconic American nameplate with a genuinely fresh approach, despite its old-school roots. descriptionSummary: Volkswagen's subsidiary Scout Motors is breathing new life into an American automotive legend with a bold, modern twist on its heritage. Two upcoming models, the Terra truck and Traveler SUV, will debut in 2027 with electrified powertrains.

description: Bentley has never been short on craftsmanship, especially through its Mulliner division. But the new Ombré by Mulliner collection might be the most visually captivating showcase of color in the brand’s history. Delivered to Bentley Rancho Mirage, this trio – a Continental GT Speed, GTC Speed, and ...

A trio of Continentals has just arrived at Bentley Rancho Mirage, each one a masterpiece of subtle sophistication.

title: How Valvoline’s $1M Mechanics Program Tackles Global Worker Shortage
description: Autoblog has interviewed the President and CEO of Valvoline Global Operations, Jamal Muashsher, about the automotive industry’s projected shortage of 4.3 million skilled workers worldwide by 2030, and the predicted 820,000 mechanic shortage in the U.S. by 2028. descriptionSummary: Valvoline's global leader discusses a pressing issue: the impending shortage of skilled automotive professionals, with an estimated 4.3 million workers worldwide lacking expertise by 2030, and a projected 820,000 mechanics in short supply in the U.S. by 2028.

title: The $63,000 Volkswagen Golf GTI Is the Most Expensive Ever Made
description: Volkswagen’s iconic GTI turns 50 next year, and the celebrations come with a serious price tag. descriptionSummary: Volkswagen's iconic GTI is hitting the big 5-0 next year, and to commemorate this milestone, they're unleashing a high-performance limited edition model. Priced at a whopping €54,540, it boasts Golf R-level power and prestige.

title: This Tiny Mitsubishi Van Has More Adventure Spirit Than Most SUVs

descriptionSummary: In the US, Kei cars fly under the radar due to restrictive laws, but if regulations changed overnight, I'd covet a Mitsubishi Delica Mini – an endearing and practical vehicle with charming proportions.

title: GM Super Cruise to Allow Eyes-Off Driving by 2028

descriptionSummary: General Motors is poised to revolutionize transportation with autonomous technology by 2028. At its latest GM Forward event in New York, the company outlined a comprehensive strategy incorporating advanced features like voice-activated assistants and real-time grid connectivity.

title: Even Sam Altman Can't Get Tesla to Deliver His Roadster Or Refund His Money
description: The year was 2017, and Elon Musk had just taken the wraps off the second-generation Tesla Roadster.
